profile.profileName: [Association of Nova Scotia Museums] ANSM Passage Project
profile.profileDescription: Implements standard collections managements system for ANSM

label.name: Description
label.description: This field contains descriptive information about the item cited in the Object Name field that does not occur in other fields.

label.name: Caption
label.description: Short descriptive caption for item.

label.name: External links
label.description: A link to websites which provide more information on the item. Web addresses must begin with "http://"

label.name: Georeference
label.description: Coordinates documenting the locations associated with the item. To look up a location, simply begin typing in the field; the system will begin searching after three letters have been entered.

label.name: Notes (internal use only)
label.description: Notes regarding item

label.name: Object Type
label.description: This field contains the descriptive modifier of the name listed in the Object Name field. Examples: mini

label.name: Object Sub-Type
label.description: This field contains the secondary descriptive modifier of the object. Examples: rapid-fire

label.name: Title
label.description: For Artifacts: Contains the title of the item cited in the Object Name field. For fine art, the curatorial title is based on that assigned by the artist. For Archival Items: Transcribe the title as it appears on the document. If there is no title, create a one based on the format of the document (ex: letter or diary) and the name of the creator.

label.name: Category
label.description: This drop-down menu indicates the Category and Sub-Category of the item cited in the Object Name field, as defined in Nomenclature 3.0 for Museum Cataloguing. Initial letters may be typed while the menu is open for faster navigation. You need only select the most detailed level of category, e.g. "Door and Window Element."

label.name: Accession Date
label.description: This field indicates the date on which the item cited in the Object Name field was legally accessioned by the institution.

label.name: Acquisition Date
label.description: This field indicates the date that the item identified in the Object Name field was acquired or registered by the museum.

label.name: Date
label.description: For artifacts, this field indicates the chronological date range for the item cited in the Object Name field. For archival items, enter the date of creation or possible chronological range. Eg. 1950 - 1954; June 1982; 6/5/2010.

label.name: Initial Condition
label.description: This field contains an assessment of the overall condition of the item cited in the Object Name field at the time of acquisition.

label.name: Object nature
label.description: This field indicates whether the item is an ‚Äúoriginal‚Äù, ‚Äúcopy‚Äù, ‚Äúreplica‚Äù, or ‚Äúreproduction‚Äù. Note: A reproduction is made to the exact specifications of an actual object. A replica is made by studying an object's image and/or its information. Eg. Recreated from a painting or photo.

label.name: Condition remarks
label.description: This field contains remarks about the condition of the item cited in the Object Name field.

label.name: Group
label.description: Holds data from the old Passage system. For new associations of objects, use collections or sets.

label.name: Military Unit
label.description: This field contains the full name of the unit that used the object. A unit, the lowest level in a military organization , is self-accounting and has a commanding officer. Examples include a battalion, regiment, ship squadron, independent company, air movement unit or battery.

label.name: Vessel Name
label.description: This field contains the name of the vessel associated with the object. The preferred format is the vessel or ship name, followed by the standard abbreviation for the type of vessel; separate the two by a comma.

label.name: Culture
label.description: This field indicates the cultural association of the item cited in the Object Name field , based on its social/geographical origin.

label.name: Measurements
label.description: Records the physical measurements of the item. Remember to indicate what units you are using.

label.name: Colour
label.description: This field lists the colours represented in the object. A semicolon and a space should separate multiple entries.

label.name: Deaccession
label.description: Records information about deaccessioned items, including date of deaccession, deaccession mode and remarks. Deaccession mode indicates the mode by which the deaccessioned item identified in the Object Name field was disposed.

label.name: Cataloguer
label.description: This field indicates the name of the individual responsible for providing catalogue data on the item cited in the Object Name field.

label.name: Cataloguer Date
label.description: This field indicates the date on which catalogue entries were developed for the item cited in the Object Name field.

label.name: Cataloguer Remarks
label.description: This field contains cataloguer's remarks pertinent to the item cited in the Object Name field, E.g. "Appears to have been modified near the base at some point in its history."

label.name: Fonds Title
label.description: This field contains the name of the fonds to which the item belongs. A 'fonds' is all of a creator‚Äôs documents written and/or accumulated and used by a particular individual, business or organization. Fonds title is composed of the name of the creator followed by the word ‚Äòfonds‚Äô. Do not capitalize ‚Äòfonds‚Äô.

label.name: Finding Aid
label.description: This field briefly describes any publicly accessible research aids created for this item.

label.name: Custodial History
label.description: This field indicates how many people owned the document before it came to the museum.

label.name: Scope and Content
label.description: This field contains text to describe the document, and is used to provide descriptive information that is not in other fields.

label.name: Exhibit History
label.description: This field contains the history of exhibitions in which the item cited in the Object Name field was included.

label.name: Subject
label.description: This field contains subject terms which briefly describe the main topic of the document and answers the question ‚ÄúWhat is this document about?‚Äù

label.name: Conservation notes
label.description: This field contains remarks about any conservation , preservation or treatment of the item cited in the Object Name field.

label.name: Scale
label.description: For archival maps and architectural plans: use this field to indicate the scale of the drawing or map.

label.name: Restrictions
label.description: This field gives details of restrictions on the item cited in the Object Name field. E.g. "Do not hang this painting in bright light; keep away from heat source."

label.name: Photo number
label.description: This field contains the reference number assigned to the print and to the negative, if applicable.

label.name: History of Use
label.description: This field describes the original and subsequent use made of the object, as assessed by an authority such as a curator, archaeologist or ethnologist.

label.name: Narrative
label.description: This field contains comments, stories, or contextual information about the object. Can include associated people, organizations, places, and events in the object's history, comments from an interpretive/curatorial perspective, text of a wall label, entry from a published catalogue, etc.

label.name: Check this box if you hold the copyright for this item
Brand
label.description: This field contains the manufacturer's brand name for the object.

label.name: Serial Numbers
label.description: This field contains the unique serial number assigned to the object by the maker.

label.name: Manufacturing Technique
label.description: This field indicates the processes, methods or techniques use to manufacture the item. Add another field to enter more techniques. E.g. "carved."

label.name: Model
label.description: This field contains the manufacturer‚Äôs model name and/or number of the object.

label.name: Patents Dates and/or Numbers
label.description: This field contains any patent dates or copyright numbers associated with the object. E.g. "patent no. 12345"

label.name: Signature
label.description: This field provides details about the form and location of the artist‚Äôs or maker‚Äôs signature on the object. E.g. "signed in black ink, lower right corner, T. A. Stone"

label.name: Nationality
label.description: Enter the nationality of the entity. Multiple nationalities may be entered by adding another field. E.g. "Canadian."

label.name: Series Volume Pub
label.description: This field contains the name of the publisher of the book, portfolio or series that incorporates the object. E.g. "John Forbes and Son Limited."

label.name: Series Volume Title
label.description: The field contains the title or name of the book, portfolio or series that incorporates the object. E.g. "Pictures of East Anglia Life."

label.name: Series Volume Date
label.description: This field contains the date of the publication of the book, portfolio or series that incorporates the object.

label.name: Other Technicians
label.description: This field contains the name of the other technician, artist, or maker who contributed to the creation of the object. In the case of prints, print makers are recorded in the Artist/Maker field and the original artist in the Other Technician field.

label.name: Cross Reference
label.description: Holds information from old Passage system. For new associations of objects, use "related objects," collections or sets.

label.name: Catalogue reference
label.description: This field indicates bibliographic references used by the cataloguer for cataloguing the object.

label.name: Marks/Label
label.description: This field contains a description of the maker‚Äôs marks or labels associated with the object. For archival items, note any defunct accession/catalogue numbers, captions or remarks added to the document.

label.name: Number of components
label.description: This field indicates the number of component parts that constitute the single item

label.name: Examination Date
label.description: This field indicates the date that the condition report of an artifact or archival item was completed.

label.name: Materials
label.description: This field lists the material from which a three dimensional item, e.g. sculpture, historical object, or ethnographic artifact is made. For archival items, this field refers to the material on which the information is written. Separate multiple entries with a semicolon and a space.

label.name: Mounting Storage
label.description: This field indicates how the object has been housed in the museum. E.g. "Hung from padded hangers in textile storage room."

label.name: Treatment Date
label.description: This field indicates all known dates of previous conservation or repair work that was done on the object.

label.name: Additions
label.description: This field outlines any additions that were made to the original artifact over the course of its history. E.g. "Muslin backing attached by blanket stitch to support sampler."

label.name: Repairs
label.description: This field outlines any work done on an object over the course of its history in order to counteract damage or deficiencies.

label.name: Coatings
label.description: This field outlines any coatings used on the object over the course of its history. These may affect care and handling, storage, or conservation treatment methods or requirements. E.g. "1988 ‚Äì Tannic acid applied to blade."

label.name: Description
label.description: Narrative biography for entity. This is the primary text used to document the entity.

label.name: Source of description
label.description: Source of entity biography. This should be a formal citation if possible. For informal sources a narrative description is acceptable.

label.name: Date founded
label.description: Date organization was founded.

label.name: Date incorporated
label.description: Date organization was incorporated.

label.name: Date of liquidation
label.description: Date organization was liquidated.

label.name: Brand names
label.description: Brand names under which the organization operated.

label.name: Manufacturer
label.description: Company that manufactured this artifact.
